title: Biomechanical_Attributes.txt
contents:
The main functions of the spine are biomechanical: to protect the spinal cord, to support upper body loads, and to facilitate trunk mobility (21)
These functions are enabled by a complex integration of passive (vertebrae, discs, facet joints, ligaments) and active (muscles) tissues plus the neuromuscular control system (22)
Disruption to one or more of these components from injury, overuse, or aging can lead to functional pathology that includes painful stress concentrations within innervated tissues (23)
